titleInfo.title: COMMTITED to the Jail of the parish of Caddo; http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn86079090/1862-07-22/ed-1/seq-1/

mods.abstract: COMMTITED to the Jail of the parish of Caddo, in the City of Shreveport, a negro man aged about 31 years, five feet one inch high, of black complexionCalls himself CHARLES and says he belongs to Lewis Moore, living in Harrison county, State of TexasThe owner or owners of said negro are hereby notified to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, or he will be disposed of as the law directsJ.BWELCH, JailorJuly 22, 18623t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU LibrariesCopyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domainPermission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
